column2: 【n.】 [C] (also 'alleyway') a narrow street between or behind buildings, not usually used by cars 小巷； 胡同
column3: A narrow alley led up between the houses to the main street.

column2: 【n.】 [C] the way in which the parts of sth. such as the page of a book, a garden, or a building are arranged 布局；布置；设计；安排
column3: All the flats in the building have the same layout.

column2: 【n.】 [C]  a district or an area of a town 街区；城区
column3: Jessica and Jason grew up in the same neighborhood of Boston.

column2: 【n.】 [U] the state of feeling excited 激动；兴奋；刺激
column3: The children were filled with excitement at the thought of visiting Disneyland.

column2: 【a.】 having energy and determination 精神饱满的；生气勃勃的；有决心的
column3: At the end of the day, the usually cheerful and spirited girl was worn out.

column2: 【n.】 [C] （铺屋顶的）瓦，瓦片
【a.】 (~ of) very typical of a particular thing or of sb.'s character 典型的；独特的
column3: Personality is often defined as an individual's characteristic way of thinking, feeling, and behaving.

column2: 【vt.】 make sb. feel admiration and respect 使钦佩；使留下深刻印象
column3: None of the people I've interviewed so far has impressed me.

column2: 【vt.】be the thing that makes sb. / sth. different or special 使有区别；使有特色
column3: The factor that distinguishes this company from its competitors is customer service.

column2: 【v.】recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people 区分； 辨别
column3: At what age are children able to distinguish between right and wrong?

column2: 【n.】 [C] the way in which two facts, ideas, events, people, etc. are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other 联系；关联
column3: There is a connection between pollution and the death of trees.

column2: 【n.】 [C] A group of people who live together and who share the work and their possessions 群居团体；社区
column3: She went to California and joined a commune.

column2: 【a.】 shared by a group of people or animals, esp. a group who live together （为同一群体所）共有的，共用的，共享的
column3: As a student he tried communal living for a few years.

column2: 【prep.】 having sth. as part of a group or set 包括···在内
column3: I've got three days' holiday including New Year's Day.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sb. from the western part of the world 西方人；西洋人；欧美人
column3: What is difficult for Westerners to understand is the real meaning of these cultural customs.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears 黎明；破晓
column3: I don't think he went to sleep until dawn.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) existing, happening, or used outside, not inside a building （在）户外的；用于户外的
column3: I love outdoor activities such as walking and camping.

column2: 【a.】 happy, or behaving in a way that shows you are happy 高兴的；兴高采烈的
column3: Before the accident he had been cheerful and confident.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sb. who tries to find a suitable partner for sb. else to marry 媒人
column3: Ours, after all, was not a marriage arranged by a matchmaker or by our parents.

column2: 【n.】 [C]  sb. who sells things, esp. on the street （尤指街上的）小贩
column3: He bought a copy from a newspaper vender.

column2: 【v.】 (AmE) (~ up ∕ along ∕ down, etc.) ride a bicycle 骑（自行车）
column3: Andrew pedaled up the road toward the town center.

column2: a.】of or being a distinctive, identifying feature or characteristic 特有的；标志性的
column3: She was about to burst into her trademark laughter when her mom silenced her.

column2: n.】[C] a special name, sign, or word that is marked on a product to show that it is made by a particular company, that cannot be used by any other company （公司某一产品的）商标
column3: The big letter "M" is McDonald's best-known trademark.

column2: 【vt.】 take sb's attention away from sth. by making them look at or listen to sth. else 分散（注意力）；使分心
column3: Try not to distract the other students.

column2: 【a.】 preventing you from concentrating on sth. 分散注意力的；使人分心的
column3: I find it too distracting to work with the television on.

column2: 【a.】 (of sounds) very high （声音）很高的；尖厉的
column3: I could hear high-pitched laughter coming from the girls' bedroom.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sb. who buys and sells a particular product 交易商；贸易商
column3: She bought the painting from a Swiss art dealer two months ago.

column2: [n.][C] the range of musical notes that sb.'s voice or a musical instrument can reach （嗓音或乐器的）音域，声区，音区
column3: Singers have to learn how to sing in the upper register.

column2: [v.]put sb.'s / sth.'s name on an official list 记录；登记
column3: How many students have registered for English classes this semester?

column2: 【v.】 make sth. have a sharper edge or point, or become sharper （使）变锋利（尖锐）
column3: Anne sharpened her pencil and got out her homework.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a person or device that makes sth. sharp 削磨的人；磨具；削具
column3: You can buy the best pencil sharpeners at low prices in our store.

column2: 【n.】 [sing.] the short loud sound of one hard object hitting against another 硬物撞击声；咔哒声；啪嗒声
column3: I heard the clack of high heels as she crossed the yard.

column2: 【vt.】 make sb. feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry 抚慰；安慰；使平静
column3: Lucia soothed the baby by rocking him in her arms.

column2: 【a.】 making you feel calm and less nervous, worried, or upset 抚慰的；安慰的
column3: My mother had a gentle, soothing voice.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sth. that makes you notice, remember, or think about sth. 起提醒作用的事物
column3: The town wanted to forget the war but the destroyed bridge was a painful reminder.

column2: 【a.】 (~ with) full of people moving about in a busy way 繁忙的；熙熙攘攘的
column3: The flower market was bustling with shoppers.

column2: 【n.】 [C, usu. sing.] sb.'s mind, or their deepest feelings, which control their attitudes and behavior 心灵；灵魂；精神
column3: She knew, at some deep level of her psyche, that what she was doing was wrong.

column2: 【vt.】 say hello to sb. or welcome them 问候；迎接；招呼
column3: She greeted each of the guests as they came through the door.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a ball of air or gas in liquid （液体中的）气泡，泡沫
column3: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.

column2: 【vt.】 give special importance to sth. 强调；重视；着重
column3: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.

column2: 【n.】 [U] energy and enthusiasm to make new things happen or to make things succeed 精力；活力；劲头
column3: People responded positively to Ruth's cheerfulness and dynamism.

column2: 【ad.】 many times 再三地；重复地
column3: Sam was repeatedly warned not to work so hard.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sb. you work with — used esp. by professional people 同事；同僚（尤为专业人士所用）
column3: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.

column2: 【v. 】(fml.) refuse politely to accept or to do sth. 谢绝；婉言拒绝
column3: The Prime Minister was asked for his opinion but he declined to comment.

column2: 【vi.】decrease in quantity or importance 减少；降低
column3: Spending on information technology has started to decline in recent years.

column2: 【n. 】[U, sing.] a decrease in the quality, quantity, or importance of sth. 下降；减少；消减；衰落
column3: There has been a decline in the size of families.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a tall cup used for drinking tea, coffee, etc.（喝茶、咖啡等用的有柄的）大杯，马克杯
column3: Jake had a quick breakfast and a mug of coffee in the morning.

column2: 【vt.】 1) happen or exist at the same time as sth. else 伴随
column3: The disease is accompanied by headache and fever.

column2: 【vt.】 2) go somewhere with sb. 陪伴；陪同
column3: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult in these activities.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] an act of saying or showing that you will not do, give, or accept sth. 拒绝；回绝
column3: His refusal to discuss the matter made me angry.

column2: 【n.】 1) [C] sth. that you say or do, often sth. small, to show how you feel about sb. / sth. （表明态度的）表示，姿态
column3: They sent me some flowers as a gesture of goodwill.

column2: 【n.】 2) [C, U] a movement of part of your body, esp. your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel （表达意思或感觉的）手势，姿势
column3: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.

column2: 【n.】 [C] (fml.) a hot or cold drink 饮料
column3: Beer is the most popular alcoholic beverage.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] a greater interest in or desire for sb.  sth. else 偏爱；偏好
column3: Many people expressed a strong preference for the original plan.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) continuing or existing all through your life 终身的；毕生的
column3: She first visited Ireland when she was 10, and developed a lifelong interest in the country.

column2: 【a.】 1) (of arguments, disagreements, etc.) very serious and unpleasant, with a lot of anger and hatred involved （争论、分歧等）激烈而不愉快的，充满愤怒与仇恨的
column3: The couple had a bitter quarrel over the division of labor.

column2: 【a.】 2) feeling angry, jealous, and upset because you think you have been treated unfairly 愤愤不平的；充满怨恨的
column3: I feel bitter about his behavior.

column2: 【n.】 [pl.] (infml.) your relatives by marriage, esp. the father and mother of your husband or wife 姻亲（尤指公婆或岳父母）
column3: We lived with my in-laws until we had enough money to buy a house of our own.

column2: 【a.】 friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors 好客的；殷勤的；热情友好的
column3: The local people were very kind and hospitable.

column2: 【a.】 doing what you are expected to do and behaving in a loyal and obedient way 尽责的；忠诚的；顺从的；恭敬的
column3: His dutiful secretary was always there to answer her boss' call when he needed her.

column2: 【v.】cook sth. slowly, or allow sth. to cook slowly, in liquid in a closed dish 炖；煨
column3: The meat needs to stew for two hours.

column2: 【n.】[C, U] a dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid in a container that has a lid 炖的菜；煨的菜（有肉和蔬菜）
column3: I'm making a stew for lunch.

column2: 【ad.】 in a state of showing pleasure and pride because of a victory or success （因胜利或成功而）洋洋得意地，耀武扬威地
column3: "I've got a job," she announced triumphantly.

column2: 【vi. (~ at  down, etc.) quickly look at sb. / sth. 一瞥；看一眼
column3: The man glanced nervously at his watch.

column2: 【a.】 containing a lot of milk 掺奶的；多乳的
column3: Water, fruit juice, and hot milky drinks are offered on planes.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a short pointed knife used as a weapon 匕首；短剑
【ad.】 used when you are giving your opinion or stating what is important about a situation 总的来说；从根本上
column3: Basically, we're looking for someone who can work three afternoons a week.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a person who is not accepted as a member of a society, group, etc. 外人；局外人
column3: I'm an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.

column2: 【v. if different people or organizations unite, or if sth. unites them, they join together in order to achieve sth. （使）联合；（使）团结
column3: We will unite in fighting crime.

column2: 【a.】 (of people or groups) in agreement and working together （人或群体）和谐的，一致的，团结的
column3: We need to become a more united team.

column2: 【a.】 1) very important or greatly respected 很重要的；神圣的；深受尊重的
column3: Few things were sacred to Henry, but local history was one of them.

column2: 【a.】 2) relating to a god or religion 上帝的；神的；宗教（性）的
column3: Certain animals were considered sacred.

column2: 【n.】 [C] the room, building, etc. where you work 工作场所
column3: How do you keep your personal problems out of the workplace?

column2: 【vt.】(infml.) quickly put sth. somewhere, usu. for a short time 迅速地放置
column3: She took out a piece of chewing gum (口香糖)and popped it in her mouth.

column2: 【vi.】come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from sth. （突然或出人意料地）蹦出，离开，脱落
column3: The top button popped off my shirt.

column2: 【a.】 not pleasant or enjoyable 使人不愉快的；不合意的；讨厌的
column3: Undercooked potatoes taste unpleasant and can be harmful.

column2: 【n.】 [C](esp. BrE) an amount of tea made at one time （茶）一次的冲泡量
column3: Nothing beats the taste of a fresh brew made from Carlisle Tea's fine quality loose-leaf teas.

column2: 【a.】 lasting or taking too long and not interesting 冗长的；啰唆的；单调乏味的；令人厌烦的
column3: We had to listen to the tedious details of his presentation.

column2: 【n.】 1) [U] the act of recording information in a computer, book, etc. 登记；输入；录入
column3: The program is used to describe the entry of data into the network.

column2: 【n.】 2) [C, U] the act of going into sth. 进入
column3: It was dark and their entry into the camp had gone unnoticed.

column2: 【a.】 (~ in) (of a habit, attitude, etc.) that has existed for a long time and is therefore difficult to change （习惯、态度等）根深蒂固的，日久难改的
column3: The idea of doing our duty is deeply ingrained in most people.

column2: 【n.】 [C]  a small table on very small wheels, used for carrying or serving food or drink （运或送食物、饮料的）手推车，台车
【vt.】 1) (fml.) eat or drink sth. 吃；喝
column3: In order to survive, human beings need to consume food and water.

column2: 【vt.】 2) use time, energy, goods, etc. 消耗；消费
column3: A smaller car will consume less fuel.

column2: 【vt.】 ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject 对···进行民意测验（调查）
column3: Over 50% of those polled were against the proposed military action.

column2: almost 几乎
column3: This report says more or less the same thing as the previous one.

column2: put warm clothes on sb. or yourself because it is cold （因寒冷）给···穿上暖和的衣服
column3: You'll have to bundle up; it's cold outside.

column2: move or get somewhere 去；前往；到···地方去
column3: The team slowly made their way back to the base camp.

column2: give sth. to sb. else, esp. after receiving it or using it yourself 转交；（用后）递给，传给
column3: She said she'd pass the message on to the other students.

column2: find sb. / sth. that is difficult to find by searching or looking for information in several different places 追踪到；追查到
column3: The police have so far failed to track down the attacker.

column1: have sb.  某事物（作为···的目标选项）
column2: Have you got any particular color in mind for the bedroom?
spend a lot of time with sb. 与···长时间待在一起
column3: The people I used to hang around with were much older than me.

column2: make sb. / sth. lively or interesting （使）变得生动；（使）变得有趣
column3: With these pictures I hope to bring the room to life.

column2: make sb. feel very annoyed 把某人逼疯
column3: Would you stop that humming? You're driving me crazy!

column2: (of a remark, etc.) have a strong effect on sb., in a way that makes them realize what the true facts of a situation are （言语等）使人豁然醒悟
column3: She saw the emotion in her father's face and knew her words had hit home.

column1: take it upon / on oneself (to do sth.)
column2: (fml.) decide to do sth. without getting sb.'s permission or approval first 擅自做主做某事；自作主张做某事
column3: He took it upon himself to personally thank each person at the meeting.

column2: continue to exist in a different situation （在不同情况下）继续存在，保持下去
column3: Attitudes learned at home carry over into the playground.

column2: (BrE, spoken) quickly turn on a piece of electrical equipment 迅速开启（电器）
column3: Pop on the stove with a loose fitting lid to allow steam to escape.
